results.title: Commonwealth Journey
results.brief_description: A record of the 1959 Commonwealth Tour of the Duke of Edinburgh, compiled film coverage of India, Pakistan, Brunei, North Borneo, Hong Kong, the British Solomon Islands, the Gilbert and Ellice Islands, Christmas Island, the Bahamas and Bermuda.

results.title: Commonwealth Arts Festival
results.brief_description: A film record of the highlights from the Commonwealth Arts Festival held in Britain in 1965. For 17 days, in London, Cardiff, Liverpool and Glasgow, there were performances of music, drama, dancing, films and verse, as well as art exhibitions. More than 20 Commonwealth countries brought their finest talents and exhibits to Britain for the occasion.

results.title: Commonsense behind the wheel
results.brief_description: The film opens with a casualty case in a hospital after a traffic accident. Rules for safe driving are enumerated and explained with practical demonstrations. Shows the need for correct hand signals and also the disastrous effects of driving whilst under the influence of alcohol.

results.title: Commonsense afoot!
results.brief_description: Opens with a newspaper summary of the accident rate. Deals with the rules for pedestrian traffic, both on the footpath and on the road; the use of school crossings; the correct way of alighting from cars, trains, and buses; the advisability of walking against the traffic on country roads.

results.title: Commonsense a cycle
results.brief_description: Shows the hazard of riding a bicycle in heavy traffic. Shows how foolish riding habits result in accidents and makes an appeal to parents as well as children to see that bicycles are kept in good order and that young children know and obey traffic rules.

results.title: Common Threads : Stories from the Quilt
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Robert Epstein, Bill Couturie and Telling Pictures
results.brief_description: This Oscar winning film celebrates five individuals who have died from AIDS. Through interviews, photos, home movies and other remembrances, the portraits of these five people and their loved ones show how they came to terms with their loss by participating in the AIDS Memorial Quilt. The film also encapsulates the history of the AIDS epidemic as reported by the news media in the U.S. from 1981-89. Including an interview with writer Vito Russo. Narrated by Dustin Hoffman.

results.title: Common heart disorders and their causes
results.brief_description: The film first reviews the proper functioning of a healthy heart and circulatory system. It then studies common heart disorders giving the history, symptoms and effects of a typical case of childhood rheumatic fever; the assumed causes of hypertension and the effects of each of the conditions which may be caused by arteriosclerosis (hardening of the arteries). Correlated with “Textbook of healthful living” by Dr Harold S. Diehl.

results.title: Common fallacies about group differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
A painter working in a classroom makes a statement about the French race and Latin temperament. A professor, over-hearing his remark, tries to correct his misconceptions. Among other facts, he points out that a nation is not a race, that members of a group are never “all anything”, that group behaviour cannot be judged by isolated cases.

results.title: Commodore 64
results.material_description: Commodore 64 video game console/keyboard, datasette, manual and cables
results.brief_description: Commodore 64 Video Game Console. (For console on display game is emulated by a concealed PC). Also includes Commodore C64 keyboard, ‘Commodore 64 User Manual’, ‘Commodore 64 Computing’ book by Ian Sinclair, ‘C2N Cassette Unit Operating Instructions’ booklet, plug, cable and cover.
